metadata.title: CVE-2020-24394 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.7.8, fs/nfsd/vfs.c (in the NFS server) can setincorrect permissions on new filesystem objects when the filesystem lacksACL support, aka CID-22cf8419f131. This occurs because the current umask isnot considered.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24394` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1080-aws - 4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-azure - 4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1081-gcp - 4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1051-oracle - 4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1013.15').
